inn1.comm: well, well, a beauty to start with, jags away off the seam past the edge of Bell's bat...but it's a no-ball. Mills will like the look of that movement. Actually it looks like it flicked the glove, what a left-off for Bell early on
opens his stance a little, drives over the top of mid-off...top shot by Bell to take advantage of the freebie
drifts too straight this time, clipped neatly away through midwicket
clipped in the air past square leg, not a million miles away from Daniel Flynn but it was well timed and races to the boundary...flying start from Bell
loses his line down the leg side, Bell moves across but it's still given as a wide
turned out to square leg
better line from Mills, on off stump and Bell stands tall in the crease, defends to mid-off
uses his feet to come at Mills, takes a step out of his crease and defends into the on side...a long and eventful opening over
movement straight away for him, on off stump and shapes away, Wright defends with an open face to backward point...brilliant piece of fielding by James Marshall
on middle, Wright defends into the leg side with a straight bat

shout from Southee as he thinks this has taken pad first as Wright tries to drive straight, Wright lucky to get away with that as it did take the pad before the bat. Very difficult for the umpire to give those
flicked firmly into the leg side, can't beat the field
comes half forward, the face of the bat again twists in his hands as he defends to cover
tight line outside off stump, Wright pushes into the covers and a good start from Southee
back of a length on off stump, Bell defends at the top of the bounce down the pitch
comes forward this time, defends square on the off side to point
this is better stuff from Mills, banged in back of a length, Bell stays on the back foot and pushes into the off side
on off stump, Bell comes across his stumps and tries to flick through the leg side but picks out midwicket
again Bell comes down the pitch and outside off, tucked between midwicket and mid-on for a single...first time the batsmen have changed ends
well bowled, on middle and defended down the pitch
now Southee oversteps, giving away another free hit, tucked into the leg side
the answer is nowhere, was well bowled by Southee as he bangs in a bouncer...Wright tries to swing it over the leg side but doesn't make contact, almost swing himself off his feet
full on off stump, powerfully driven but straight at mid-off
flicked firmly down to mid-on, a fumble allows Wright to get off the mark
good length outside off stump, Bell defends to the leg side
effortless pick-up over the leg side from Bell, on leg stump and he flicks it over the deep square-leg rope for the first six of the day
corrects his line, angled into the off side by Bell who has made a very positive start
play and a miss from Wright, goes for a cut but it's a bit too close to the body for the shot
keeps Wright in defence, pushes into the covers
a big shout from Mills, but it was a touch high and heading down the leg side, they pick up a leg bye as he scuttles down to third man
outside off, hint of swing, left alone
on off stump, pushed back to the bowler who fields in his follow through
poor delivery on leg stump, easy pickings for Bell who flicks it past short fine-leg in the circle and away for another boundary
comes back off the seam, Wright manages to open the face and run it down to third man
defended from outside off stump down to mid-on, Bell being positive in defence and attack
a neat back-cut from Bell, easily bisects slip and gully down to third man
first proper bouncer of the day, Wright ducks underneath it
hint of width, slashed away square but Brendon McCullum at third man scoots around and keeps them to a single
taken from outside off stump and flicked away through square leg, there's a man on the boundary now so it stays as a single
sweetly timed on-drive, straight to mid-on, that came out of the middle as well
outside off stump, opens the face and defends to backward point
steps towards the bowler, defends out to cover
opens the face, runs down to third man
on off stump, Wright not being given any freebies to hit, defends down to mid-off
good ball, comes back off the seam a touch and Wright defends close to his body
turned off the hip through the leg side
driven off a thick out side edge, down to third man
driven into the covers, not quite timed, picks out the fielder
comes onto the front foot and defends, a thick inside edge to short fine-leg

short and Wright finally manages to middle a square cut, it looks like four all the way but McCullum makes a brilliant save at third man, tumbling to his right, getting up and throwing on one movement
whipped to the right of mid-on, another good piece of work keeps him to a single
back of a length on middle, defended down the pitch
drifts onto leg stump, clipped behind square and Southee makes a good save at short fine-leg...Mills lucky to get away with that one
comes forward, bat and pad together, defends to cover
a lone shout from Mills as this one takes the pad, heading well down the leg side
goes for the cut again, a bit tight to his body and hits it hard into the ground to backward point
picks out James Marshall again at backward point, not able to find the gaps at the moment...there will be a little bit of frustration growing. A good maiden from Mills
good start, on off stump, defended to mid-off
full outside off stump, Bell drives firmly into the pitch and Mason parries the ball in his follow through without knowing too much about it
delicate shot from Bell, width outside off stump and he guides it away through the vacant slip cordon down to third man
better line, on middle, Bell tucks it into the leg side...even his defensive shots are speeding off the bat
a well judged quick single as he pushes towards mid-off
that's more like it from Wright, still not quite timed but thumped with plenty of bottom hand through mid-on for his first boundary
pushed down towards mid-off who is fairly deep, another well-taken single
cut away hard, straight to backward point
waits nicely for this one, plays it late down to third man...didn't try to force that one, just placed it
comes down the pitch, defends on the move into the covers
angled into the off side as Bell again plays on the move
comes very early at the bowler this time, Mills holds his nerve and Bell readjusts to defend
on middle, Wright defends tightly with bat and pad together

the first breakthrough, it just seemed a matter of time until something had to give. Tries to loft it over mid-off, but he doesn't time and just lobs a simple to Vettori on the edge of the circle. Some good pressure from the New Zealand bowlers, but Wright never got going today
full on middle first up, dug out down to mid-on
loses his line down the leg side, takes the pad and deflects past Hopkins for a couple of extras to bring up England's fifty
squeezed off a thick inside edge through square leg, just played a fraction early
beaten outside off stump by some seam movement, good delivery to end a successful over
lovely shot from Pietersen, too full on middle and effortlessly put away through mid-on
flicked off his hip this time as Southee pulls his length back, out to deep square-leg
outside off, opens the face down to third man
goes wider to Pietersen this time, left alone through to the keeper
defended from outside off, down to mid-on
pushed off the back foot, placed between cover and mid-off and he scampers a quick single to keep the strike
good line outside off, hint of movement back off the seam as Pietersen lets it go
full ball on the stumps, Pietersen tries to whip it through the leg side but gets a leading edge, along the ground, to mid-off
good line on off stump, turned out to midwicket
defended from outside off down to mid-on
manages to find the gap at cover with this time, not timed properly and it's kept down to a couple
a big stride to meet the ball, defends firmly to mid-off
pushed square on the off side, can't find a gap
uses his feet early, Southee drops his length back and Bell plays into the off side
tries to run this way to third man, but can't beat backward point
again Bell comes down the pitch, balls runs off the edge down to third man
short and wide, but Pietersen can't put it away as he picks out cover
wow, he tries something on that occasion as he goes for a huge swipe over the leg side to a ball outside off. He doesn't make contact and just looks rather ugly
gets on the front foot and drives hard, straight to long on
poor delivery - or great if you're Pietersen who takes the shin-high full toss and flicks it with plenty of power through square
forces this one hard down the channel, some lift off the track, the ball seams away from a good length and Pietersen leaves it accordingly
some swing outside off, down on one knee and drives out to the covers where it's well fielded
overpitched on off and pushed back to the bowler who throws to the striker's stumps, knocks off the off bail and squidges out to third man and they take a run
didn't quite come out of the middle that one, as it's flicked off the legs to square
round the wicket, floats it up there, but Pietersen is tempted into nothing other than a defence on the front foot
rocks back and peels off a cover drive... to the covers, of course
defended on the front foot
rocks back and pushes out to the covers, with a reel of the wrists
defended on the front foot
comes out and defended on the front foot once more, Vettori making a good start with just the single off the over
overpitched on middle, adriven out to the man at mid on who returns sans fuss
down the track, looks to attack, gets the under edge to fine leg where Southee is quick, if not entirely accurate, in returning
slower ball, pushed up full on the legs and flicked out in front of square
on off, the batsman comes out and flicks out just in front of square, keeping the runs ticking
comes down the track, looks to flick to leg, plays all around it and the ball carries on through past off stump
slower one, wide outside off, cut to Styris in the covers, having not really connected with it
Bell tees off, freeing his arms, and aiming for mid off but drags it over midwicket
on off again, this time Pietersen drives it out to mid on
drags it down a touch and Bell peels off a pull out very wide of mid on
Pietersen thinks about the sweep before the ball's even delivered, down on one knee but mistimes it
outside off, cut down to point
better line and length, pushed out to mid on now
full delivery in line with off, an outside edge skews to point
outside off, drives at it but again catches the outside edge, the ball carrying on to third man
comes out and runs it fine through third man, the ball travelling quickly after Bell opens the face
defends down off the back foot into the covers and immediately calls "No!"
swings back in to the right hander, and nips in a long way off the seam, Bell driving inside the line. How's Mason's luck

comes down and there's an appeal for lbw, he's not out there but scrambles to the other end and Taylor's throw comes in direct from short midwicket and Bell's out by a good 30 centimetres, a moment's hesitation costing him
some swing away, defended on the front foot
more defence on the front foot
drives out to the covers and they can only take the one
defends hard on the front foot, in line with middle and off
defended on the front foot, again in line with off. Tight work here from Vettori
outside off, Pietersen reaches out, hits it early and sweeps hard through square
defended back down the pitch in line with off
on middle, tucked off the hips behind square
on the front foot, pushed into the legs in defence
on the legs, flicked hard off them, Southee runs round from deep square leg to collect and return
done him, the batsman pokes forward, the ball coming back in off the seam and just to say failing to shave the edge
outside off, defended on the back foot down
on the front foot, eased to the legs without much power
moves back and cuts hard off the back foot to the covers
down the track, down on one knee and up goes the ball - perhaps not what he was intending - on the sweep towards square
some turn generates a pop up on the front foot towards the covers, but very safe
change of pace and trajectory now, Bopara on the back foot defending in line with leg this time
in line with off, cut out off the back foot to the deep cover region
too wide from him, cut out to point
defended back down the pitch in line with off
picked him up! Bopara comes out and drives hard back at Styris who snaps a sharp chance, a nothing shot from the batsman really and he will be kicking himself now
on middle, and off the mark straight away with a turn off the legs on the on side
moves over across the stumps and eases the ball from off to the leg side
some movement away outside off, eased down to third man
on the front foot, the batsman pushes forward and right over it in defence
nudged to the on side to collect a single and bring up England's 100
just outside off, good length, Collingwood gets over and drives out to the covers with hardly any power
some turn now from Vettori, drawing Collingwood into the shot away from his body, following the movement
gets on the back foot and plays right down off the back foot
plays against the spin now, driving out off the legs to mid on
outside off, pushed at it into the covers
lifted well over the top from one which is on the toes and there's a good effort from Mason running down towards the rope from mid on, gets a hand on it but nothing more
a good shot, well cheered by his home crowd, as he opens the face and guides it down with an open face to third man
pushed out again and they run through the single
goes down on the front foot, and swept out from off, the ball cannoning into the pads
outside off, driven through the covers with a flaying shot
on off, pushed to short midwicket without much power, more defensively than anything
a touch outside off, cut out to point
extra loop comes in on leg, the batsman comes out and squeezes out to mid on on the front foot
on the front foot, defended in line with off. Encore une dot
outside off, pushed to the covers and they run through quickly
some loop, and Pietersen's down on one knee to sweep hard to square
outside off, pushed down off the back foot out to long off
not quite a deliberate shot, the batsman gets down on one knee and paddles it up and over the shoulder to fine leg
defended on the front foot to the short cover region
outside off, pulled round from outside the line and sraight to square
on the front foot, swept to square, an appeal for the direct hit at the non-stierke's end where Pietersen is running, but he is well in
some big room outside off, tempts Collingwood into the firm drive out to the covers
down the track and drives up and over, straight down the ground for a flat six which sets off the crowd, Pietersen following through right over his shoulder
drags it only a touch short in line with off and he's powerfully into the sweep shot
pitches outside off, turns away, and cuts hard into it
on the front foot, defended hard, this one coming in quicker and flatter
goes down on one knee for a big sweep but Umpire Llong is not interested, the ball hit him in line, and Hawk-Eye had it just clipping the top of leg. Marginal, though
down on one knee once more, defended
on middle and leg, pushed out to short midwicket
down the track and that's a beautifully struck lofted drive played straight as a die
outside off, opens the face and works it down to fine leg
defended down into the covers
on the front foot, pushed off the off stump line short in on the legs
on the front foot, driven out to long on
forced off the back foot through the covers
comes forward and defends from off stump
pushed comfortably down the ground
flighted on middle and off, Pietersen defends with soft hands
thinks about giving himself run, Vettori spots it and fires this one at middle and leg, Pietersen has to adjust and defend
goes for the sweep, doesn't make contact, off the pad into the leg side
flicked from middle stump to midwicket
comes down the pitch, stays leg side of the ball and slaps it through the covers without much timing
dragged down a touch short outside off, Pietersen is quickly onto it, swings hard through midwicket
defended from off stump, Southee fields in his follow through
again uses his feet, Southee goes back of a length and Collingwood pushes through the covers
full ball on the stumps, dug out down the ground to long on
brings out another sweep, comes off the top edge but falls well away from any fielders, and it takes Pietersen to his fifty off 62 balls
nicely flighted on off stump, Pietersen beaten by the lack of pace as he misses his sweep
another top edge on a sweep, this one is closer to the fielder - Styris - at deep square-leg but it goes one bounce to him, he should have made more of an effort to come in for the catch
worked down to long on, fifty partnership up
worked into the leg side
nice flight and pace on middle, Pietersen comes forward and defends
on off stump, Collingwood defends down the pitch
comes down the track at Mills, gives himself room to cut hard through the covers out to the sweeper
steps across outside off, defends to the leg side
now Pietersen comes down the pitch outside leg, clubbed straight to cover
flashes outside off stump, doesn't make contact with his attempted cut
whipped nicely through midwicket, this time some sharp running brings a couple. Collingwood dives to make his ground, but it wasn't really required
floated way down the leg side, awful ball, the keeper can't take it and the fielder can't save it...five wides
very gentle stuff, patted back from off stump
turned through midwicket...England have to make this count
flicked down the pitch, Taylor dives in his follow through
toss up on the stumps, punched firmly down the pitch, can't beat Taylor's dive
flicked in the air down to long on
fired in at leg stump, Collingwood tickles it straight at short fine-leg and scampers a single. Good comeback from Taylor after those five wides first ball
outside off, pushed to cover
huge heave from Collingwood as he comes down the pitch and swings through midwicket off a thick inside edge
beaten on the inside edge as Pietersen charges early, Mills follows him outside leg stump...well bowled
swings very hard from outside off through midwicket, but comes right off the toe of his bat and almost dribbles into the deep
short ball, helped around backward of square and there's time for two
uses his feet again, angled away through backward point down to third man
flat on middle and leg, pushed down the on side, Taylor fields
well bowled, full on leg stump, dug out to midwicket
chip down the ground, well short of long on
low full toss, hammered down the ground to long on...New Zealand getting away cheaply with this Taylor over so far
ooh, way down the leg side, big wide
clipped hard through midwicket, but it's just another single as long on scurries around
swung hard and flat through midwicket, can't find the boundary, though, as McCullum again shows his prowess in the outfield at long on
inside edge into the pads, rolls into the off side for a quick single
short ball, Pietersen goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge past the keeper and down to the boundary...lucky for the batsmen, tough for the bowler
jeepers, looks like Pietersen has decided to open up here as he charges down the pitch and goes for huge mow through the leg side...all that effort and he doesn't make contact
he hit that one, and how. Dragged in short again, Pietersen latches on and this one comes right out of the middle, away to deep midwicket before anyone moves
charges the bowler yet again, doesn't keep control of the shot and it bobbles out to midwicket
well bowled, watches Pietersen give himself room and fires in a yorker, dug out down to long off
clubbed away through midwicket, straight to the man in the deep
well, what happened there...Collingwood goes for a reverse sweep and it's seems sure he'll be caught, but Jamie How can't get to it at short third man

wow, what a shot, that is awesome...it's a repeat of his six off Muralitharan at Edgbaston, as he switches his grip and reverse-hits Styris over deep cover (or should that be deep square-leg) for a memorable maximum
worked away for a single this time, much calmer
pushed back to the pitch
tucked off the pads to keep the strike
gets an inside edge into the pads
and now it's Collingwood's turn, launches a short ball high over deep midwicket and he comfortably clears the ropes...great blow for a man out of form
nicely bowled, a slower-ball yorker which Collingwood jabs at and then scampers a single
that was close to leg stump, Pietersen walked right across and exposed all three stumps...Davis doesn't call a wide, fair call
full ball on off stump, Pietersen can't get it away
another powerful shot, straight down the ground with such force that even though Flynn gets a hand on it he can't prevent the boundary
whipped away over deep midwicket...brings up England's 200, the last fifty off 37 balls
full outside off, opens the face and drives it past short third man, takes Collingwood to an excellent half-century off 52 balls, on his home ground
turned away off the hip, and there's a comic piece of fielding as Mason parries the ball past Flynn running in from the rope, and it gives away two more
driven on the up through the covers, looks for two but it's not quite on this time
worked off the stumps out to deep square-leg
full outside off, driven firmly down to long-off
on leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
flat on middle, nudged into the leg side
fired in at yorker length, dug out and straight back at Vettori
tickles it off his pad, but can't beat short fine-leg
on middle, defended into the leg side
played down the on side, superb over from Vettori with just a single off it. Some control back for New Zealand
goes for a huge swing from outside off, gets a bottom edge to short fine-leg
misses a mighty heave, not a million miles from bowling him
chopped away through backward point, just a single, a good little passage for New Zealand
well bowled, yorker on middle stump, but well played too as Pietersen opens the face and runs it away to deep backward-point with enough placement for two
third umpire into action as Pietersen heaves across the line, Hopkins whips off the bails but there's nothing happening there
that's the most extraordinary shot, he switches his grip to that of a left-hander and launches Stryis high over long-off for a might six. That is one of the more incredible shots you'll see
crunched down the ground to long off
turned out to deep midwicket, brilliant running from Pietersen...the foot is firmly down on the accelerator
pushed into midwicket again, KP wanted the second but Collingwood says no this time
dropped and it's gone for six as well, Collingwood launches down the ground but Mason can't hold it at long on. He was right on the rope, but helped it over the line
gone this time, Collingwood goes for a cut and chops into off stump. End of a fine innings and a vital wicket for New Zealand as they try to limit the late carnage
pushes his first ball square on the off side
on leg stump, turned out to deep square-leg
driven square on the off side with his typical wristy flourish
backs away to give himself room, drives straight to Vettori at cover
flicked straight to short fine-leg, Shah hurries to make his ground with a good dive
chopped into the ground by the stumps, rolls away towards short third man
turned from off stump into the leg side, Pietersen makes sure he keeps the strike
low full toss, thumped down to long on
good bouncer from Mason, over leg stump and Shah doesn't connect
top shot, goes over mid-off who is inside the circle and collects a valuable boundary...used his strong wrists superbly
this one is whipped through midwicket with timing and placement, Shah hurries back for a couple
slower ball, Shah waits for it and opens the face to backward point...brings Pietersen back onto strike on 98
short, wide and hammered away out to deep cover, takes him 99 and gives him the strike
short ball, pulled away down to fine leg and he reaches a brilliant century off 104 balls...his first ODI century in England and his sixth overall
swung away through midwicket, along the ground to the deep fielder
huge swing from Shah, gets an inside edge to a poor ball down the leg side and it beats short fine-leg
that's a massive blow from Shah, gets hold of this over deep midwicket and he holds his pose for the photographers...he knew that was six, and it's a big blow over a big boundary
yorker outside off stump, driven away to deep cover
driven down to long on, Pietersen moved outside leg stump when the bowler was half way through his run up...he's so confident right now
thumped down the ground to long off
another mighty blow from Shah, straight down the ground and it almost finishes in the commentary box...length from Southee, needs to be fuller
slammed down to long off, can't get back for two
gives himself room, Southee goes wide outside off and is called wide by Steve Davis
he creamed that, but straight at extra cover who is right on the edge of the circle
room outside off, Pietersen goes over extra cover this time, one bounce and over the rope, Southee not able to find the yorker consistently, but this is his first ODI
now Southee oversteps as Pietersen drives down to long on, he wants the strike back to face the free hit but it's over to Shah
swung hard down to long on, a single is a good result off that ball for New Zealand
leg stump yorker, swung hard down to long off as Shah gives himself room
well bowled, full and straight, helped down to long on
great shot straight down the ground, Shah was able to get underneath a length ball and lofted between long off and long off
beaten outside off by a full yorker, good take from Hopkins at the stumps
brilliant from Shah, low full toss and he sweeps it over short fine-leg...Shah is an expert at that shot, played it perfectly on this occasion, a top innings from him
goes down to sweep again, Mills sees him so goes for a bouncer but it beats Hopkins and runs away to the boundary...the wheels are well and truly off here for New Zealand
heaved out to deep square leg...Shah keeps the strike with 40 off 20 balls
low full toss outside off, sliced to short third man, a metre either side and that was four
outside leg stump, flicked sweetly out to deep midwicket
bouncer over leg stump, called wide by umpire Davis...more extras
another short one, no-ball this time, no free hit as it's a height no-ball, but fairly brainless bowling on the second occasion
another huge six from Shah, straight as a die down the ground and the crowd are in catching action again...300 up for England
low full toss outside off, slammed along ground through extra cover...Flynn fumbles as he slides, but recovers well to prevent the boundary
trying to clear the deep square-leg boundary this time, a slower ball on a length, it was there to hit but he just got a bit too much top edge and found the fielder
another no-ball, so Ambrose will face, as Pietersen slams down to long off with huge power...again he misses out on having a free hit
cut away down to third man, so he gets off the mark, and England reach 307

inn2.comm: outside edge, half-fended down off the back foot to point
some swing away and some movement off the pitch too, the ball moving wider, the batsman leaves this one
down the track, some good pace as the ball's boomed in outside off and McCullum stands up tall, squaring at it then half stopping his bat
on the legs, McCullum bends over it to work off the legs behind square
on the front foot, full length, pushed out to mid on
squares in behind this one in line with off, defends sharply down
pushed across him, McCullum looks to pull across the line, doesn't quite get hold of it
on the legs, pulled round behind square
good lick from Sidebottom, hard down the channel, pitches just outside off, straightens and rises through
on the front foot in line with off, doesn't quite get hold of it but pulls it to midwicket
some good lift again, slightly wider, this time he shoulders arms
this is the first one he gets hold of and off it goes, whistle-clean, in front of midwicket, scooped up with so much ease, McCullum right down the track and plays across the line
kneed off towards fine leg
outside off, plenty of width, back of a length too, and a cleanly struck cut goes hard towards the rope, doesn't need too much invitation on that one
pushed back towards leg stump now and defends it out this time
goes right through him, pitching outside off, nipping back and How plays all around it
defends hard right back down the line, Pietersen runs in to collect it
on the front foot, played back forward towards Anderson who dives down to stop it well
stays over tehw wicket, pushes across him on off and he pulls it out to deep square
big width outside off, the batsman plays into the ground
pushed across him, the batsman shoulders arms
driven out on the front foot to the covers
defended out on the front foot to the short cover region
outside off, attempts the hook and a huge outside edge pings up out to third man. Not quite picked up there by Anderson. Sidebottom is furious
outside edge, much better control this time down to third man
dug out straight over long off, not much foot movement, then again not very much needed
outside off, some width, the batsman cuts at it off the back foot
defended forward
on middle and leg, flicked off to square where Sidebottom runs in and throws furiously, as in hard, back to the keeper
banged in the bouncer, McCullum edges it on to his helmet and it clatters down. He rehearses the shot, annoyed that he didn't quite connect
...but he doesn't miss out this time, with a flowing back-foot cut that leaps over the rope following one bounce
outside off, pushed back down the ground towards the bowler
defended down on the front foot in line with off
slower ball curls in towards middle and leg, pushed out to square leg
just bring sit back enough to pitch on leg, the batsman gets over it to work it to short midwicket
short one, pulled round to square leg and this time there's one bounce before Mascarenhas picks it up. Sidebottom can't believe it, his hands flying up to his face
defended back down the line of middle
steps back and cuts hard behind square for four more, Collingwood with the hopeless dive at backward point
on the legs, pulled round behind square, to Sidebottom on the 45
clipped off the legs, again to that 45-degree angle, Sidebottom runs round from deep third man
pushed towards leg and McCullum keeps it out
pulled right through square, Wright can't quite chase it down
pulled hard straight from middle, but didn't quite get hold of this one, that one came in at a fair lick - he's hit the 90mph-mark a few times
forced across the right hander who's dragged into chasing a fairly wide one, and Ambrose takes the through ball
defended back down the line of off on the back foot
defended on the front foot in line with off
yet another dot
breaks the mini-shackles with a composed straihg drive back down the track
a touch wider from Sidebottom this time, worked into the covers
and Broad strikes with his first ball! McCullum steps back and cuts one which rises up from outside off straight into Bell's hands at extra cover
on the legs and flicked away to deep backward square leg where Sidebottom scampers round and picks it up with ease
fired hard down the channel, this one Marshall can leave, and indeed he does
on the legs, brushed off the pads again out to Sidebottom at deep backward square
defended back down in line with off
on the back foot, defended back down the line once more
fired fairly wide outside off, just shy of being an extra
outside off, goes to have a look outside off then quickly brings his bat back in inside the line
outside off, defended into the off side
more defence
outside off, again defended down in line with off
shoulders arms and lets the ball go through to the keeper
hits a good length and is defended down once more
outside off, tight again, defended again
and once more the defence comes in down the line of off
on middle and off, looks to pull it round but doesn't quite get hold of it
beauty, flung in with venom just outside off, the batsman swishes at it but is completely undone and some good lift, too
defended hard back down the track
driven out to mid off this time
outside off, played down, a hint of an edge down
outside the legs, flicked off dwon to fine leg
outside off, played down to the covers, a pick-up and shy at the non-striker's stumps
on middle and leg, the ball comes in on a good length and he bends over the ball who defends down
on the legs, flicked off the legs to square
defended out on the front foot to the covers
outside off, played down out to the gully region
outside off, the ball nips in a touch and is defended down
well bowled, squares into that one, an edge skews out to point
outside off, flashes hard at it, away from the body
defended out to the covers this time
flicked off the legs out in front of square, it's chased down by Bopara who flicks it back to Broad and he throws it on
defended off the back foot down
outside off, cut hard off the back foot to point
on the legs, pushed out to the leg side on the front foot
dabbed down to the gully where Collingwood picks it up and like a rocket his direct hit runs out Marshall by a good three inches
an appeal for a strangle down off from an under edge
outside off, shouldered arms to let a good-length delivery through
defended off the back foot down
picked up by Pietersen at mid off but the throw comes in just a touch wide - which is enough
driven back down the ground, Pietersen's the man who gets to it but England fielders are swarming everywhere, all abuzz
defended off the back foot into the covers
pushed out on the front foot
on the stumps, turned to midwicket
rising outside off stump, pushed firmly into the covers but can't find the gap...pressure building on How

oh well, it's all happened there...a brilliant save from Wright at midwicket and both batsmen are stranded, but his throw is way wide of the stumps and the batsmen can make a couple. A real miss for England
turned into the leg side
goes for a pull, but doesn't make contact and is taken high on the back leg
defended out to backward point, good over from Anderson
on the stumps, pushed down to mid-on. Interestingly, Broad was holding that delivery cross-seam, sometimes bowlers to that to prevent it swinging or to try and get some uneven bounce
sticks to his tight line on off stump, defended into the covers
drops this one a touch shorter, How comes across the crease and pulls down to fine leg, one bounce to the fielder
driven firmly up to Pietersen at mid-off
drives outside off without much footwork, ball flies past the edge through to Ambrose
play and a miss again as Taylor goes for a cut, this is a fine spell from Broad
good line on off stump, How comes half forward and defends back to Anderson
wide outside off, How drives and gets a thick outside edge down to third man where Ryan Sidebottom makes a good sliding save
cramping Taylor for room on middle and leg, defended down to mid-on
pushed down to mid-off, still can't find the gaps...excellent bowling from the England quicks
well, he gets his first boundary but it wasn't entirely convincing as the balls just lobs over the head of Anderson and to straight for Pietersen at mid-off...that's 1000 ODI runs for Taylor
driven into the covers to end the over
full outside off, How latches onto an impressive drive but hits it straight at cover...that had some heat on it
and the pressure pays off, How trying to go over the top of cover just manages to pick out Luke Wright at cover...the bat twisted in his hand and a deserved second wicket for Broad
extra bounce outside off, nice lift through to Ambrose as Styris lets it go
beaten by a leg-cutter outside off, moves away late, another cracker from Broad
touch fuller, Styris comes forward and defends square on the off side to backward point
full outside off stump, in the driving arc for Styris but he can't beat mid-off where Pietersen keeps them to a single
good pace from Anderson, 89mph, homing in on middle, turned out to midwicket
loses his line and length this time, dragged down short and wide, Styris goes up and over cover where there's no one on the boundary
tucked off leg stump this time, neatly played to deep square-leg
a drive from Taylor, goes in the air towards mid-off as the bat turns in his hands, but falls well short of Pietersen
through the covers along the ground this time, not timed perfectly so it's hauled in by Paul Collingwood...decent over for New Zealand
bouncer from Anderson, Styris ducks and his taken on the back...the ball balloons wide of Ambrose who has to chase it down and can't prevent two leg byes
chopped away from outside off down to third man, good throw from Ravi Bopara keeps them to a single
good line outside off, Styris shoulders arms
defended square on the off side
another nice drive from Styris, to the left of mid-off but again Pietersen keeps it to a single
takes the pad down the leg side, good tumbling save from Ambrose as Taylor was thinking of a single
straight and turned away to deep backward square, Taylor keeps the strike
starts well, on off stump, Taylor nearly gets a leading edge back down the pitch
turned from outside off stump through midwicket, placed with the perfect weight to allow him back for a couple
touch short, rocks back to cut and steals a single to Broad at backward point
tickled into the leg side, they want a short single and Collingwood opts to throw at the non-striker's end...Styris would have just made it
beaten outside off stump by one that doesn't turn
punched down to long on, decent start by Swann
angles in towards the stumps, takes the pad onto the leg side
on off stump, pushed out to cover
driven off a thick outside edge, in the air down to third man
slower ball outside off, driven powerfully square on the off side, Collingwood makes a good save at backward point
tight line, outside off stump, and all Taylor can do is punch out to cover...these are the overs New Zealand will have to make the most of
hint of width, goes for a strong cut and gets a bottom edge that land short Ambrose, who makes a good take going back on himself towards the leg side
turned from off stump towards short fine leg, it's another quick single but he has enough to beat Wright's throw
worked out through square leg, early call for two and Taylor comes back swiftly
low full toss, swung away hard past square leg...Anderson dives full length to prevent a boundary at deep square-leg
nicely bowled, held back a touch by Swann and it beats Taylor's sweep, taking him on the pad
turned off the stumps, can't beat short fine-leg this time
easy single this time as he tucks it from off stump into the vacant area at square leg
defended hard into the pitch, Wright gets a hand on it in his follow through before mid-off tidies up
driven hard through the covers, not quite timed but there's time to come back for a couple...brings up New Zealand's 100, a vital stand for the visitors

gone...and Wright gets the key wicket in rather strange style, Taylor just chipping a catch straight down to Sidebottom at long-on, it was barely a push from Taylor but he timed it so well, too well in fact, and it was a simple catch
good ball, beats Styris outside off as he pokes forward
driven firmly to Ian Bell at cover
driven square through cover, the sweeper keeps them to a single...halfway mark of the innings
spin from outside off, Styris plays with bat and pad together
goes down early for a paddle sweep from outside off stump, lobs where short fine-leg would have been
outside off, defended square on the off side
dragged down short, slow turn around from the left hander who cuts hard through the covers
beaten by the arm ball, it doesn't spin and cramps Flynn for room as he tries to cut
turned off the stumps into space at midwicket
dropped into the off side, Flynn races off for a quick single and a direct hit would have been close...but he gets his bat in the way of the ball
driven on the up towards backward point, another athletic save from Collingwood
driven at the top of the bounce to Collingwood again
angling into the body, no room to play with for Styris and all he can do is force it into the leg side
driven crisply back down the pitch, Wright stays low in his follow through to collect
dropped a little shorter, helped out to deep square-leg with a pull
goes for a sweep from outside off, takes the pad into the leg side
cut away off the back foot through the covers
misses a sweep outside off, Ambrose takes off the bails and they go to the TV umpire...there's a little bit of movement from Styris' back foot, but he seems OK and the 'not out' is soon flashed up
turned down to short fine-leg, sharp single but the throw is wide in any case
guided away to short third man...asking rate continues to climb (I know that's obvious, but anyway)
tucked down to short fine leg, another single to end another over
big shout from Wright as he takes Flynn on the pads, but it pitched well outside leg
turned neatly through midwicket, but can only collect one as Pietersen at mid-on is prowling (if Pietersen ever really prowls)
uses his feet to come at Wright, dropped down towards backward point
driven through the covers, but again it's only a single out to the sweeper
outside leg, takes the pad into the leg side as Flynn tries to produce something much mightier
taken from way outside off stump and turned through midwicket

the pressure tells again, and that should be the match well and truly sown up for England as Styris picks out deep midwicket as he tries to find a boundary...something had to give, the run rate has only been going one way
cut away through the vacant slip area, no very convincing but Flynn won't care...Wright brings out a rather pointless dive, he was nowhere near it
that's a good shot, fetched from outside off stump and swept out through deep midwicket...back-to-back boundaries
pushed between backward point and cover, well taken single, Flynn again looks a  compact, promising player
nicely bowled, beaten by turn and bounce from outside as he pushes forward
more turn, rips between bat and pad, takes the back leg and evades Ambrose for a couple of leg byes
fired across him, the batsman shoulders arms
flicked off the legs up out towards square leg, Anderson possibly not picking that one up and he had to throw his body at it in the end, the ball bouncing behind him after that
worked out again off the toes
on the legs, squeezed out to midwicket
ripped across him cut hard to point where a diving Collingwood does well to stop the ball
short, on the back foot, played down
some width outside off, drives out in front of point where Sidebottom runs round and collects five or ten metres inside the rope
definitely a wide down leg, the ball moving away off the seam after pitching
cut down into the gully off the back foot
on middle, down on one knee, and sweeps round
some wild movement back in to the btsman, and it doesn't get up hugely, the ball pushed out square
taken off the toes, driven out in front of midwicket
driven forward back to Swann who picks it up with ease
pushed across him and forces him to have a go at the cut, the ball just popping over the edge
some swing back in to the left hander, taking the ball towards the legs, Flynn bends over it, looking for the drive
clipped off the legs behind square and they come back well
outside off, pushed out to point and some good running there
looks to attack, Wright sees him advancing and places the ball fuller, making him defend at the last second
pushed out just to say on the leg side and some more good running
defends hard on the front foot, pushing the ball into the leg side
some bi gturn back in and defended on the front foot once more
popped up towards mid on but pitches well in front of the fielder
round the wicket, eased off with the wrists
ooh, a touch of pop up towards midwicket, but again it landed safe
again some movement back in from outside off, the batsman defends forward on it this time

some movement in from outside off, played down to point, choped down, Collingwood runs right past it with his clasping right hand nowhere near the ground and they sneak the run when there was a gapin run-out opportunity
defended on the back foot this time
stays over the wicket and the right hander flicks it off the legs to midwicket
a play and a miss, the batsman on his back foot, cuts, and lets the ball pop over the upper edge

some width outside off, cut hard off the back foot and evades Mascarenhas at backward point, though he did get a hand on it. Sidebottom is really firey and angry today, more so than his usual wiles of late
cut off the back foot again, this time to the fielder at deep point
turned in from outside off, the batsman looks to flick it to short midwicket but his timing is a touch awry
dome width outside off, cut away to the covers
goes to sweep from outside off, the ball pitching awawy from him
a huge shout as the ball rushes on to the pads, but the appeal stops in the throat
on off, gets hold of this sweep
some movement back in to the right hander who switches it out with ease in front of square
pushed on to the front foot and correspondingly pushed back out to the covers
a good shot, the ball comes in short and it's lifted off the base with a firm pull that goes aerial, deliberately, before pitching just inside the rope
some swing back in on the legs, swept round behind square
defended back down just in front of him and they chase through the single as Bopara runs in quickly to gather
much width outside off, swivelled right round off the glove, fell short of Ambrose, who effects a long barrier but the ball bobbles over his leg
shot! Width outside off and there's a square drive through backward point that is very well struck indeed
round the wicket, puts it on a good length and it's pushed out to the covers
ah, Flynn goes, adjudged to have strangled through to Ambrose and at first it looks as if he clearly has, but replays show that the ball brushed the thigh pad
big appeals first up, but the tone has a slight twang of non-conviction
defended hard on the front foot
defended once more, not much on offer for Vettori so far
defended down on the back foot into the turf to round out a good wicket maiden
redirected off an off-stump line out behind square
on off and Vettori mirrors his right-handed colleague's shot, taking the ball from off to just in front of square
on off stump and pulled round behind square
on the legs, flicked out to midwicket
outside off, pushed out behind point
defends into the covers and they charge through
down on one knee and gets a good result, sweeping up and over to just inside the rope
the hard sweep once again, this one a bit squarer and Sidebottom runs round to tidy up
good bowling from Swann, turning back in and generating the leading edge as Hopkins was completely fooled, trying to turn it to the leg side
pushed on to middle and worked out to short leg
width outside off and again some turn in, worked with the spin, moving it out to midwicket
pushed forward, they look for the run, decide not to take it and England decide to "Hold it, hold it"
width outside off, cut to point and that's held by Bopara on his knees at backward point
short ball on the legs, swept round to fine leg
down on one knee, shouts of "Catch it!" and Collingwood has two wickets in three balls, Vettori picking out Anderson in the deep with his pull
bangs it in short, it hardly gets up off the turf, Collingwood kicks the ball at the stumps but misses by a fair way, everyone finding it hysterical
banged in short, but this time it's ruled wide as it creeps to leg
defended back down the track on the front foot
slower ball, the batsman comes out and pushes down the track
some width outside off, tempts the batsman into a cut off the back foot that he doesn't get quite right
outside off, cut off the back foot into the covers
the batsman gives himself some room to step back and lift this high and straight, just wide of the oncoming Shah who is right next to it when it leaps over the rope
defended on the front foot
outside the leg stump, the batsman steps back and lets it go through
backs away again, pushed into the covers, they chase the single through

backs away and goes for the pull, hits it up a lot higher than he wanted, Wright running hard from midwicket and catches it over his head, excellent catch, particularly with plenty of fielders rushing round near him
short ball on the legs, Southee looks to pull it but the ball rushes on to him
outside off, a vain swish away from the body, the ball moving wide off the seam
a good shot there from Southee, lifts it from outside off and times it all the way over backward square, the ball going fairly flat
Bell closes out the match with a catch in the covers, Southee leaning back and chipping up right to the fielder
